column1: Message
You have decided to prepare to quit smoking. You will feel good if you keep your promise to yourself.
You have decided to get ready to quit smoking. You will feel bad if you break your promise to yourself.
You've committed to preparing to quit smoking. We hope you'll be sticking to it.
You've committed to getting ready to quit smoking. We hope you'll not break your commitment.
You want to be somebody who is prepared to quit smoking. Thinking about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully will help you to become this person.

You want to be somebody who is ready to quit smoking. If you do NOT think about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully, it will be more difficult to become this person.
Most people who prepare to quit smoking think that thinking about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully may help to move away from smoking.
Most people who prepare to quit smoking believe that NOT thinking about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully may make it hard to move away from smoking.
The majority of people believe that thinking about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully may help to move away from smoking.
The majority of people think that NOT thinking about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully may make it hard to move away from smoking.
Studies conducted by psychologists have found that thinking about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully may help to move away from smoking.
Studies conducted by psychologists show that NOT thinking about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully may make it hard to move away from smoking.
Experts recommend thinking about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully to move away from smoking.
Experts advice that NOT thinking about the person you would like to be once you have quit smoking successfully may make it hard to move away from smoking.

To improve your time management, make the most of waiting times. It happens to everyone: we wait in lines, waiting rooms, train stations, for water to boil, etc. How could you use waiting times to do your assigned activity before the next session? Please formulate a rule that has the form "If [situation], then [do activity]." For example, "If I sit on the train in the morning, then I will think about the person I would like to be once I have quit smoking successfully." Type your rule into this chat.

To make better use of your time, schedule breaks between tasks. The human brain can only focus for about 90 minutes at a time, so try to have a break at least every 90 minutes to avoid burnout. How could you make use of breaks to do your assigned activity? Please formulate a rule that has the form "If [situation], then [do activity]." For example, "If I take my lunch break, then I will think about the person I would like to be once I have quit smoking successfully." Type your rule into this chat.

Please think about the time between this and the next session. When, where and how do you plan to do your assigned activity? Please formulate a rule for completing your activity that has the form "If [situation], then [do activity]." For example, "If I have finished brushing my teeth in the morning, then I will think about the person I would like to be once I have quit smoking successfully." Type your rule into this chat.

Please think about the time between this and the next session. When, where and how do you plan to do your assigned activity? Please formulate a rule for completing your activity that has the form "If [situation], then [do activity]." For instance, "If I sit on the bus on my way back home from work, then I will think about the person I would like to be once I have quit smoking successfully." Type your rule into this chat.
